name: Floodplain complexity
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown: Floodplain/off-channel features stay diverse/connected at moderate floods, reflecting minimal loss.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Delineate side channels, oxbows, and wetlands and assess connectivity during moderate floods using field checks and available mapping.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Multiple active features connected during moderate floods and consistent with historical complexity.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Partial complexity remains with some features truncated or partially isolated.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Most off-channel features are lost or only minimally connected.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Floodplain is simplified or leveed with little or no off-channel function remaining.
